caption.title: Examples of HIV assay development and related research studies supported by CEPHIA.

tr.td: • How the gut inflammasome and specific HIV antibody subclasses change as HIV infection evolves • How timing of treatment initiation after HIV infection impacts kinetics of HIV reservoir seeding and opportunity for cure

td.bold: novel signatures of recent HIV infection

tr.td: • Searches for antibodies reactive to peptoids in a large ‘peptoid shape library’ • Multiplexed assay utilizing viral and antibody markers identified and interpreted through a machine learning algorithm

• Examination of the factors in HIV resistance, including mutation, selection, recombination, and drift • Development of a single genomic assay for HIV incidence and transmitted drug resistance mutation screening • Independent evaluation of the Sedia Asanté™ HIV-1 Rapid Recency® Assay, currently in use by PEPFAR at international sites
• Development of a theoretical framework and web-based tool for consistent time of infection estimation based on subject-level diagnostic testing histories and the properties of diagnostic assays
